model_example: Thermo Fisher Vitrobot / Leica EM GP2

description: Production inference for 8 CRAIDL AI agents; 24/7 availability for real-time clinical trial support. Development/training on SDRE.
Fast operational tier for TRE Zone 2 processing (OMOP ETL, CDISC transforms). Bulk storage on SDRE.
Zero-trust perimeter, zone isolation, NIST CSF 2.0 aligned
5-year cloud compute, storage, AI services (Calgary region, DHDP-compatible)
SSO, MFA, role-based access for TRE zones
5-year enterprise license with audit trails
Leverages VITAL/GEMINI foundational ETL work; OHDSI tooling deployment

Major renovation of existing Li Ka Shing Centre lab space: structural work for 4 negative-pressure isolation rooms (-25 Pa) with airlock entries and interlocking doors; plumbing for 4 en-suite bathrooms (toilet/shower/sink); HVAC ductwork modifications; electrical for monitoring and entertainment; fire suppression; building permits and engineering. Includes extended-stay amenities: hospital beds, entertainment systems (TV/WiFi), work surfaces, in-room meal delivery capability, intercoms for 14+ day quarantine.
justification: Estimate based on comparable CHIM facility construction; may require detailed engineering assessment

description: ≥12 ACH, HEPA exhaust filtration, continuous pressure monitoring
Telemetry, SpO2, temperature, video surveillance for 24/7 participant monitoring
BSL-2+ biosafety cabinet, validated containment, pathogen handling capability
Age-specific parameters (neonate to adolescent) for rare disease trials
Low-volume accuracy for rare disease dosing, gene therapy administration
Gene therapy 15-year follow-up capability, patient registry integration
For follow-up visits, family convenience, rural patient access
EDC/CDASH linkage for rare disease registry, RareKids-CAN integration
OpenSpecimen API, FHIR endpoints, Zone 2/3 data flows for specimen-phenotype linkage
5-year license, 21 CFR Part 11 compliant, multi-site federated model
Dynamic consent, FHIR integration, custom workflows
caTissue to OpenSpecimen migration services
Epic FHIR API integration for BioBank specimen-EHR linkage
Renewable consent workflow implementation for research participants
OpenSpecimen certification training for BioBank personnel
Custom development for ingesting data from novel UAlberta devices (glucose sensors, wound sensors, VR systems)
SOPs, templates for standardized device validation designs (iSMART/Digital Health Unit)
Network analyzer testing equipment to support Gupta/Light labs device development
Commercial CGM, BP monitors, wearables for comparison standards in validation studies
Direct connection to provincial PACS infrastructure via DICOM protocol for imaging AI
justification: Enable radiomics AI agent access to medical imaging data

description: Reserved SDRE GPU capacity for radiomics feature extraction; replaces dedicated nodes. Leverages UAlberta HPC.
ComBat normalization and AI-calibration protocols for multi-site imaging standardization
justification: Ensure imaging data comparability between rural and academic sites

description: High-speed cache for active CT sinograms and MRI k-space data. Archive on SDRE.
justification: Enable Dr. Simpson's rawdiomics methodology on pre-reconstruction imaging data

description: High-performance workstations for radiomic feature extraction and radiogenomic correlation
justification: Support imaging biomarker development and correlation with omics data

description: Reserved SDRE capacity allocation, access fees, integration development for CTAP workloads. Connects TRE to UAlberta HPC.
Voice-to-structured clinical trial data pipeline. Integrates Dr. Ross Mitchell's AI Scribe with EDC for automated data capture.
SDRE GPU allocation for LLM fine-tuning, model versioning, evaluation. Operational inference on CTAP servers.
Secure pipeline for Zone 1 bulk extracts from Connect Care via AHS Datawarehouse (Snowflake). Supports OMOP ETL.
Head-up tilt testing for POTS diagnosis; 60-70° controlled positioning, rapid tilt capability for autonomic function testing. Supports NCT06721949 taurine trial.
justification: Essential for POTS and autonomic dysfunction clinical trials

description: Non-invasive finger cuff hemodynamic monitoring for adrenergic function assessment during tilt testing and Valsalva maneuver.
justification: Gold standard continuous hemodynamic monitoring for autonomic trials

description: Quantitative sudomotor axon reflex testing for postganglionic sympathetic sudomotor function; critical for small fiber neuropathy assessment in diabetic and Long COVID patients.
justification: Only test for postganglionic sudomotor function in clinical trials

description: Integrated software for HRV analysis, baroreflex sensitivity, CASS scoring, and composite autonomic function assessment.
justification: Required for standardized autonomic function scoring in trials

description: High-resolution ECG for cardiovagal function testing including deep breathing and Valsalva ratio assessment.
justification: Research-grade ECG for cardiovagal function endpoints

description: 40 mmHg resistance device for standardized Valsalva maneuver testing in autonomic function protocols.
justification: Standardized Valsalva testing for adrenergic function

description: Respiratory rate control for deep breathing test component of autonomic function assessment.
justification: Controlled breathing protocols for cardiovagal testing

description: Capnography for enhanced cardiovagal assessment and hyperventilation testing protocols.
Cerebral blood flow velocity monitoring during orthostatic stress testing; critical for cerebral autoregulation assessment.
justification: Cerebral autoregulation endpoints for POTS and Long COVID trials

description: Near-infrared spectroscopy for continuous cerebral oxygenation monitoring during tilt testing and orthostatic challenge.
justification: Cerebral oxygenation monitoring during orthostatic stress

description: Age-appropriate restraints and sizing adaptations for pediatric autonomic testing at Stollery Hospital 1D.
Smaller sweat capsules sized for children for pediatric sudomotor function testing.
